column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=What are the gay bars like ?
#Text=They were just as you would find them in New York where gay men hang around and they have their music and their dancing .
#Text=Are they flamboyant ?
#Text=When I first became aware of it , it 's like in Iran , Ahmadinejad says there 's no homosexuals in Iran ...
#Text=It 's because they kill them .
#Text=Well whatever it is , but in China I do n't hear of any , either boastfully or with reticence , the acknowledgment of homosexuals .
#Text=I always stayed in the hotel because I do n't have the language so I could n't stay in a Bed & Breakfast in China or wherever you did in Cuba .
#Text=You speak Spanish , you said .
#Text=But I do not speak anything .
#Text=When I noticed this , I would sometimes have room service , and invariably it was a guy , sometimes two , who were very very effeminate .
#Text=They really were .
#Text=There 's just one thing about how free it could be .
#Text=How did you get introduced to a gay bar in Beijing ?
#Text=I got introduced to it because I needed interpreters and in order to get interpreters , I had people who were college students , Americans , sometimes of Chinese origin .

#Text=One of them in particular who went to Yale , who came to Toronto from Canton as a young boy , and when he graduated from high school in Toronto he went to Yale and after graduating at 21 , returned to China and taught English in one of the high schools in Beijing .

#Text=When I went it was very hard to get interpreters because anybody who could speak English and Chinese was taken by corporations at high paying jobs because all of these multi-national corporations having Chinese partners needed interpreters .
#Text=Including the European ones , right ?
#Text=English is the international language .
#Text=Everybody .
#Text=Everybody .
#Text=So people like me would have to really scratch around to find somebody .
#Text=I would get to know journalists very easily because I knew the bureaus .
#Text=I could go to the New York Times and they had a five or six man bureau and some of the Chinese workers were there .
#Text=" Can I get somebody to moonlight for me for a little bit ? "
#Text=" Well no , we ca n't give you one of our people , but he has got a cousin over here , who 's working part-time at Kentucky Fried Chicken and you can see him after " .
#Text=So this is how I met this fellow from Yale .
#Text=Because he knew the city , he not only served as my interpreter when I had interviews , but he took it upon himself to escort me places , including these bars and sex shops .
#Text=I 'm always interested in prostitution because that is really something that involves danger .
#Text=It involves a kind of corruption because everybody abolishes it , but it exists .
